data.title: Weathering With You: Best 15 Real Life Locations in Tokyo
data.meta_description: These are the real-life locations that were featured in Weathering With You.
data.text:
Are you a fan of Makoto Shinkai & Your Name?

Then keep reading!

Makoto Shinkai, the director of Kimi No Na Wa (Your Name), has released a new movie called Weathering With You (Tenki no ko).

It centers on Hodaka Morishima and Hina Amano. Hodaka moves to Tokyo and encounters a girl who can somehow control the weather.

The movie came out on July 19th, 2019 and it was a huge success.

Like Your Name, Weathering With You (Tenki No Ko) takes place in Tokyo, so we can see a lot of real-life locations.

Note: I already watched the movie, but this article doesn’t have spoilers.

We also have a video showing you the real-life locations, check it out!

This post is divided into 3 parts:

a) A step-by-step, location-by-location guide to the most important places that were featured in the movie.

b) More real-life locations from Weathering with You in Tokyo that would be nice to visit, but I don’t think that they are a must-visit.

c) Other places that were featured in the trailer but didn’t play an important role.

Outline

Step-by-step tour

Where to start?

The best way to start your anime pilgrimage tour is at any of the following stations:

Shinjuku JR

Shinjuku Sanchome

Shinjuku Tokyo Metro

Shinjuku Oedo

Seibu-Shinjuku Station

Shinjuku-Nishiguchi Station

All the above stations are in the same area (Shinjuku), so just make sure to go to the Kabukicho Exit.

If you have a JR pass, Shinjuku JR will be the best option.

*This tour will take you around 4-5 hours.

Kabukicho

Manga Café

Start the anime pilgrimage tour by going to the manga café where Hodaka stayed.

Address: Japan, 〒160-0022 Tōkyō-to, Shinjuku-ku, Shinjuku, 3-chōme−20−5 ニューサンパークビルB1F

—

Hina’s part-time job

Then walk around 4 minutes and you’ll see a McDonald’s.

Something important took place here. Don’t worry, I won’t give spoilers.

Address: 日本、〒160-0021 東京都新宿区歌舞伎町１丁目２４−１

—

Shinjuku O-Guard

5 minutes from McDonald’s you’ll find the next spot.

Address: Japan, 〒160-0023 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Nishishinjuku, 7 Chome−1−1

—

Several Roads in Kabukicho

10 minutes from the previous bridge, and you’ll be sure to recognize the scene where Hodoka was in the doorway, sitting on the floor.

Walk 10 seconds, and this was the place where Hodoka and Hina started their escape.

Address: 〒160-0021 東京都新宿区歌舞伎町２丁目２７ アタックビル

—

Here is one more scene of the main characters running in Kabukicho.

Address: エコロパーク 歌舞伎町第20

—

Hotel Serio

Address: 2 Chome-15-13 Kabukicho, Shinjuku City, Tokyo 160-0021, Japan

—

Tenkaippin

Close to the Godzilla Statue, we can see Tenkaippin, the popular ramen restaurant.

Note: This spot is close to one of Code Geass’s real-life locations.

Address: Japan, 〒160-0021 Tōkyō-to, Shinjuku City, Kabukichō, 1-chōme−14, 歌舞伎町１丁目１４−３ 第１０３東京ビル １・２Ｆ

In both movies, Your Name and Weathering with You, Shinjuku is the ward where we can visit the most real-life locations.

Torii (Japanese traditional gate)

As you might guess while watching the trailer, this is the most important spot in Weathering with You.

Note: You can’t go to the rooftop. Just take pictures outside the building.

Here’s one picture that I found online of what the building’s rooftop looks like in real life:

Unfortunately, the building was demolished in January 2020 :(

Here is a picture of how the “sacred place” looks days before it is to be demolished.

Hodaka’s lodging in Tokyo.

The next spot is where Hodaka was staying while he was in Tokyo.

Take the train from Shinjuku Station and get off at Kagurazaka Station,

Take the B1 exit and after 2 minutes on foot, you’ll spot the house.

I know the house is quite different in real life. But, believe me when I say that this is the house.

Address: 日本、〒162-0818 東京都新宿区築地町２０−２

Meijiro Station

6 minutes from Meijiro Station, you can see the railway line where Hodaka was running. One of the most exciting moments took place here.

Address: 3 Chome-1-40 Mejiro, Toshima City, Tokyo 171-0031, Japan

Tabata Station

30 seconds from the South Exit of Tabata Station, you can spot another location.

Together with the building in Yoyogi (the one that was demolished), this is the most important place featured in Weathering with You.

Address: 1-chōme-17 Higashitabata, Kita-ku, Tōkyō-to 114-0013, Japan

More real-life locations of Weathering with You

These are not as important as the ones listed above, but I think that they are worth mentioning.

The locations below are pretty far from each other. So, my recommendation is:

Travel around Tokyo, and if where you’re going happens to be near one of these Weathering with You locations, pay it a visit. Otherwise, specifically seeking out the landmarks that I listed in this post will take you a lot of time.

Yamano Tower

Tthe tower seen outside the window in the shot above is the NTT DoCoMo Yoyogi Building.

Closest Station: Yoyogi Station or Minami-Shinjuku Station

Address: 1-chōme-53-1 Yoyogi

Shibuya Crossing

The most popular crossing in the world was also featured in the trailer.

Closest Station: Shibuya Station (Hachiko Exit)

Tokyo City View Observation Deck (Roppongi Hills)

At the very beginning of trailer 1, we can see the Roppongi Mori Building and its Observatory Deck.

Here’s another image of Roppongi Hills. We can also see Tokyo Tower.

Photo credit: @nadukari_h

Closest Station: Roppongi Station

Address: 6-chōme-10-１ Roppongi, Minato City, Tōkyō-to 106-0032, Japan

Ikebukuro Police Station

You know what happened here. :D

Address: 1 Chome-7-5 Nishiikebukuro, Toshima City, Tokyo 171-0021, Japan

Hotel Amie

Close to the Ikebukuro Police Station, there is the hotel where this scene took place

Address: 1 Chome-1-10 Ikebukuro, Toshima City, Tokyo 170-0014, Japan

Minatokushiba Park

Not too far from the hotel, you can see another location. This is where Hodaka and all the other main characters were having fun.

Photo credit: touyoko_com

Address: 4-chōme-8 Shibakōen, Minato-ku, Tōkyō-to 105-0011, Japan

Odaiba

Hodaka and the Weather Girl did something here.

A picture of Hareonna (100%晴れ女) in front of Tokyo Teleport Station.

Address: 1-chōme-2 Aomi, Kōtō-ku, Tōkyō-to 135-0064, Japan

Other locations

Finally, these landmarks were featured in the movie but didn’t play an important role.

Shinjuku Central Park (Cocoon Tower)

A cool building that is visible throughout Shinjuku is shared by 3 colleges and vocational schools.

The cocoon theme is to convey an image of a cocoon that “nurtures the students inside.”

Closest Station: Tochomae Station

Address: 2-chōme-11 Nishishinjuku, Shinjuku City, Tōkyō-to 160-0023, Japan

Koenji Hikawa Shrine

Koenji Hikawa Shrine is a weather shrine where people pray for good weather. (Funnily enough)

The movie features the same kind of ema (wooden plaques for writing wishes) as the real shrine. You might notice they’re oddly shaped like geta. (Japanese wooden sandals) That’s because, in olden Japan, these sandals would be tossed in the air as a spiritual way of forecasting weather.

Photo credit to @furutamandola

Closest Station: Koenji Station

Address: 4-chōme-44-番19号 Kōenjiminami, Suginami City, Tōkyō-to 166-0003, Japan

Nozomi Slope

Photo credit: @Kijam5cm

And for our observant readers- yes! Nozomi Slope (のぞき坂) was also featured in Saekano: How to Raise a Boring Girlfriend.

Closest Station: Kishibojimmae Station or Zoshigaya Station

Address: 2 Chome-12-21 Takada, 豊島区 Toshima City, Tokyo 171-0033

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Do Weathering with You & Your Name share the same universe?

Short answer: yes.

I have two articles and two videos explaining it. Take a look:

Where to buy merchandise from Weathering with You?

I found some goods in Animate.

As for T-shirts, UNIQLO Japan were selling tees of Weathering with You and Your Name.

Who did the soundtrack for Weathering with You?

RADWIMPS, the Japanese rock band that created the soundtrack of Your Name, returned for Makoto Shinkai’s new project, in charge of its soundtrack like the song heard in the trailer.

The official album was released the same day that the movie came out (July 19, 2019)

The songs that were featured in the trailer are:

“Is there still anything that love can do?”

“Grand Escape (Movie edit) feat. Toko Miura”

Is the movie on Netflix?

At the moment, is only available on Netflix Philippines.

When is the DVD coming out?

The DVD will be on sale in Japan on May 27th, 2020.

Hina’s snacks

If you’re curious about what kind of junk food Hina is holding:

Nissin Chicken Ramen Instant Noodle

Koikeya Seaweed & Salt Potato Chips

And yes, you can buy them at any convenience store in Japan. Try them out if you get the chance!

The snacks that appear in the movie have the same names and packaging as in real life.

Which one did you like more? Weathering With You or Your Name? Let me know in the comments below.
